BucketBalance.description: Represents and tracks the amount remained or owed for a certain type of service by certain customer

id.description: Unique Identifier within the server for the bucket

href.description: A resource URI pointing to the resource in the OB that stores the detailed information for the bucket

name.description: Friendly name to identify the bucket

description.description: Text describing the contents of the balance managed by the bucket

bucketType.description: Type of prepay balance bucket (e.g.: promotion, deposit, bonus, data, voice, or any other service type)

reservedAmount.description: Indicate the reserved amount on the bucket

validFor.description: The period for which the balance in the bucket is valid

status.description: Status for the balance (active, expired, suspended)

product.description: A reference to the product whose consumption is managed by the bucket. This is an array to allow scenarios where a given bucket is shared between different products.

partyAccount.description: A reference to the account that owns the bucket

realizingResource.description: A reference to the resource that realizes a product. This is an array to allow scenarios where a given bucket is shared between different resources.

relatedParty.description: Used to provide information about any other entity with relation to the balance, for instance to define customer hierarchy for the balance (e.g.: customerId, userId, )

AccumulatedBalance.description: Represents and tracks the aggregated amount remained or owed in certain account which is owned by certain customer for a set of buckets.

name.description: Friendly name to identify the aggregated balance

description.description: Text describing the contents of the aggregated balance

totalBalance.description: Aggregated for a set of prepay balance buckets associated to the product

bucket.description: A reference to the buckets involved in the aggregation

product.description: A reference to the product whose consumption is managed by the bucket . This is an array to allow scenarios where a buckets are shared between different products

partyAccount.description: A reference to the account that owns the buckets aggregated

relatedParty.description: Used to provide information about any other entity with relation to the balance, for instance to define customer hierarchy for the balance (e.g.: customerId, userId, )

type.description: A preconfigured value that describes a TopUp type which determines the prepay balance bucket in which the top-up is done (national-voice, roaming-voice, promotional-voice, data, ....)

channel.description: Indicator for the channel used to request the top-up operation. Structure including at least attribute “name”

amount.description: Amount (can be monetary or non-monetary) to be recharged in the bucket

product.description: A reference to the product related to the bucket that is impacted by the balance related operation

BalanceTopupRequest.description: Represents a detailed description of a recharge operation requested over a bucket (defined by a specific product or reference to a product (i.e.: a commercial id such as an msisidn) and a service type)

id.description: Unique Identifier within the server for the recharge operation request

href.description: A resource URI pointing to the resource in the OB that stores the detailed information. This is typically the resource url to retrieve individual top-up operation details

requestor.description: Identifier for the user/customer/entity that performs the top-up action. This can be used to indicate the identifier of an agent that performs the operation on behalf of a user via a customer service channel. Structure including at least attributes “role” and “name”.

isAutoTopup.description: Indicates if the topup requested is an autotopup (to be processed periodically)

recurringPeriod.description: For autotopup indicates the periodicity for the recharge operation (monthly, weekly, )

nrOfPeriods.description: For autotopup indicates the number of occurrences of the period the recharge operation must be executed. If not included then no limit is set to stop the executionof the topup every period

paymentMethod.description: Payment method used for the recharge operation (e.g.: cash, credit card, …). Structure including at least attribute “name”. Notice that the use of a voucher can be managed as a specific methodtype, where he voucher code can be passed as value.

voucher.description: Identifier for the voucher when the topup can be perfomed by this means (referenced by a voucher based payment mean). This attribute is left in this release to keep compatibility with previous version and for implementations that do not relay on paymentMethods. A voucher can be managed as a specific methodtype, where he voucher code can be passed as value.

validFor.description: The period defined for the recharged amount to be part of the prepay balance. This could be used to define expiration times to remove balance not consumed.

requestedDate.description: Date when the top-up request was received in the server

confirmationDate.description: Date when the top-up was confirmed in the server

status.description: Status of the top-up operation Supported values are: - confirmed - cancelled - in progress

bucket.description: A reference to the bucket impacted by the request. This is used in scenarios where the requestor knows beforehand the bucket that is going to be impacted instead of just referring to the commercial identifier of the impacted product and the type of bucket created under that product

partyAccount.description: A reference to the account that owns the bucket impacted by the balance related operation

relatedParty.description: Used to provide information about any other entity with relation to the operation

type.description: A preconfigured value that describes a TopUp type which determines the prepay balance bucket in which the top-up is done (national-voice, roaming-voice, promotional-voice, data, ....)

channel.description: Indicator for the channel used to request the top-up operation. Structure including at least attribute “name”

targetId.description: Identifier for the entity that receives the transfer (reference to a product via a commercial identifier such as an msisidn that relates to an internal product id)

amount.description: Amount (can be monetary or non-monetary) to be transferred

product.description: A reference to the product related to the bucket that is impacted by the balance related operation

BalanceTransferRequest.description: The BalanceTransfer resource is a detailed description of credit transfer operation requested between two buckets (reference to products owned by customers and consuming credit when using a service).

id.description: Unique Identifier within the server for the balance transfer operation request.

href.description: A resource URI pointing to the resource in the OB that stores the detailed information. This is typically the resource url to retrieve individual transfer operation details

reason.description: Text describing the reason for the adjustment

requestor.description: Identifier for the user/customer/entity that performs the top-up action. This can be used to indicate the identifier of an agent that performs the operation on behalf of a user via a customer service channel. Structure including at least attributes “role” and “name”.

targetType.description: Intended for scenarios where the transfer is done from one bucket type to another (from voice to data). A preconfigured value that describes a Transfer type which determines the prepay balance bucket in which the transfer is done

receiver.description: Identifier for the user/customer/entity that receives the transfer action when it is required to indicate additional customer hierarchy information regarding the entity receiving the balance transfer

transferCost.description: Associated cost to be charged for the transfer operation (can be monetary or non-monetary)

costOwner.description: Indicates the entity responsible to assume the cost of the transfer operation

requestedDate.description: Date when the transfer request was received in the server

confirmationDate.description: Date when the transfer was confirmed in the server

bucket.description: A reference to the bucket impacted by the request. This is used in scenarios where the requestor knows beforehand the bucket that is going to be impacted instead of just referring to the commercial identifier of the impacted product and the type of bucket created under that product

partyAccount.description: A reference to the account that owns the bucket impacted by the balance related operation

relatedParty.description: Used to provide information about any other entity with relation to the operation

type.description: A preconfigured value that describes a TopUp type which determines the prepay balance bucket in which the top-up is done (national-voice, roaming-voice, promotional-voice, data, ....)

reason.description: Text describing the reason for the adjustment

amount.description: Amount (can be monetary or non-monetary) to be recharged in the bucket. It could refer to positive (increment) or negative (decrement) values

product.description: A reference to the product related to the bucket that is impacted by the balance related operation

BalanceAdjustmentRequest.description: the BalanceAdjustment resource is a detailed description of credit adjustment operation erformed on a given bucket (defined by a specific product or reference to a product (i.e.: a commercial id such as an msisidn) and a service type)

id.description: Unique Identifier within the server for the balance adjustment operation request

href.description: A resource URI pointing to the resource in the OB that stores the detailed information. This is typically the resource url to retrieve individual top-up operation details

requestor.description: Identifier for the user/customer/entity that performs the top-up action. This can be used to indicate the identifier of an agent that performs the operation on behalf of a user via a customer service channel. Structure including at least attributes “role” and “name”.

validFor.description: The period defined for the adjusted amount to be part of the prepay balance. This could be used to define expiration times to remove balance not consumed.

requestedDate.description: Date when the top-up request was received in the server

bucket.description: A reference to the bucket impacted by the request. This is used in scenarios where the requestor knows beforehand the bucket that is going to be impacted instead of just referring to the commercial identifier of the impacted product and the type of bucket created under that product

partyAccount.description: A reference to the account that owns the bucket impacted by the balance related operation

relatedParty.description: Used to provide information about any other entity with relation to the operation

BalanceActivity.description: The BalanceActivity resource is a detailed description of a specific balance-related action that has happened over a given bucket balance. Typically a recharge/transfer/adjustment request creates one activity, but a request for an auto-topup operation actually triggers multiple periodic balance-related activities.

type.description: A preconfigured value that describes a type of balance-related performed (topup, transfer, adjustment)

date.description: Date when the balance related operation took place

action.description: A reference to the balance-related operation that triggered the action

amount.description: Amount (can be monetary or non-monetary) that was involved in the balance operation

bucketBalance.description: A reference to the bucket involved in the balance-related operation

amountBefore.description: Remained amount in the bucket involved in the operation before it took place

amountAfter.description: Remained amount in the bucket involved in the operation after it took place

product.description: A reference to the product related to the bucket that is impacted by the balance activity

partyAccount.description: A reference to the account that owns the bucket impacted by the balance activity

relatedParty.description: Used to provide information about any other entity with relation to the balance activity

id.description: Unique Identifier within the server for the reserve operation request

relatedParty.description: Used to provide information about any other entity with relation to the operation

reservedAmount.description: Amount (can be monetary or non-monetary) to be reserved in the bucket

BalanceReserveRequest.description: The Balance Reserve Operation resource is a detailed description of a balance reserve operation requested over a bucket (defined by a specific product or reference to a product (i.e.: a commercial id such as an msisidn) and a service type)

href.description: A resource URI pointing to the resource in the OB that stores the detailed information about a reserve

type.description: A preconfigured value that describes a TopUp type which determines the prepay balance bucket in which the top-up is done (national-voice, roaming-voice, promotional-voice, data, ....)

requestor.description: Identifier for the user/customer/entity that performs the top-up action. This can be used to indicate the identifier of an agent that performs the operation on behalf of a user via a customer service channel. Structure including at least attributes “role” and “name”.

remainedAmount.description: Amount (can be monetary or non-monetary) to be remained in the bucket

isAutoDeduct.description: Indicates if the reserved balance is auto deducted after a time period

validFor.description: The period defined for the reserved amount. If reserve expires, the amount reserved will be deduct or unreserve by the value of isAutoDeduct parameter.

requestedDate.description: Date when the reserve request was received in the server

confirmationDate.description: Date when the reserve was confirmed in the server
